newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH GARMENT MAKER SETS ISSUE PRICE AT PLN 22.
newsitem.headline: POLISH GARMENT MAKER SETS ISSUE PRICE AT PLN 22.

text.p: The Polish jeans garment maker Zaklady Przemyslu Odziezowego Elpo SA (Elpo), which seeks the parallel market's listing, set the issue price of its 600,000- share issue at 22 zlotys, the president of the company said.
"We have set the issue price at the highest level of an earlier set range, at 22 zlotys," Kazimierz Brzezinski told a news conference.
He also said the company, which starts its initial public offering on Monday, was planning to enter the bourse in March next year.
He said the firm expected its net profit to grow to 1.3 million zlotys in 1996, to 1.8 million in 1997, to 2.5 million in 1998 and to 3.4 million in 2000, from last year's 0.4 million zlotys.
The company saw its sales rising to 13.8 million zlotys in 1996, to 16.9 million in 1997, to 23.1 million in 1998 and to 31.3 million zlotys in 2000, up from last year's 12.9 million zlotys.
